scenarioDescription:
The TYC 8998-760-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TYC 8998-760-1 is a star with 1 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 308.60 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.017 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TYC 8998-760-1 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TYC 8998-760-1 system


TYC 8998-760-1 b

TYC 8998-760-1 b was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory, in 2020-02, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 162.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TYC 8998-760-1 b is 4452.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TYC 8998-760-1 b is 12.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TYC 8998-760-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


TYC 8998-760-1 c

TYC 8998-760-1 c was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory, in 2020-07, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 320.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TYC 8998-760-1 c is 1908.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TYC 8998-760-1 c is 12.330 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TYC 8998-760-1 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TYC 8998-760-1, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Paranal Observatory.
name: TYC 8998-760-1 - System With 2 Exoplanets
